Pipe leak chills in Pattee

A hole in a steam pipe left West Pattee and North Sparks Building without heat for three hours Friday afternoon as workers attempted to repair the damage PERIOD

The first indications of a leak were discovered last Monday when steam began flowing from the ground near Jordan Hall said Ardath Johnson an employee of the Office of Physical Plant consumer information services PERIOD

Johnson said plant workers began digging that day to find the leak but did not find the hole until Friday PERIOD

The hole was discovered at  p.m PERIOD and the steam from the two buildings was shut off at  p.m PERIOD so the workers could fix the leak PERIOD

 Johnson said Friday PERIOD 

A worker at the repair site said the pipe leaked because it had rusted through PERIOD  he said PERIOD

The work was finished at about  p.m. Johnson said PERIOD

 by Pete Baratta
